paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant ATTRV30M, its penetrance, and the effects of C1q ablation in a mouse model.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Penetrance in Sweden, Cyprus and Portugal are 2 to 22%, 28% and 80%, while the age of onset is 52, 46 and 32 years of age respectively.
Penetrance in Sweden, Cyprus and Portugal are 2 to 22%, 28% and 80%, while the age of onset is 52, 46 and 32 years of age respectively.

functional_data.summary: The TTR variant leads to increased amyloid deposition and altered protein stability.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the variability in penetrance across different populations.
key_quotes: Penetrance in Sweden, Cyprus and Portugal are 2 to 22%, 28% and 80%, while the age of onset is 52, 46 and 32 years of age respectively.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
